result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rickardo Otha Richards

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rickardo Otha Richards not in court, in custody.  
Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Rickardo Otha Richards.  
Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Plea and Sentencing.
Defendant in custody at Dodge Correctional and was not produced for today's hearing
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 17, 2023 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Rickardo Otha Richards not in court, in custody.  
Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Rickardo Otha Richards.  
Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Scheduling Conference. Defense request a plea and sentencing hearing/
Defense advised plea documents to be submitted to the court 24-hours in advance of the hearing. 
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw in court.  William R. F. Ackell for Stephanie Kureger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense request an additional status date for reasons stated on the record
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw in court, defendant Rickardo Otha Richards not in court, in custody.  Stephanie Krueger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense requested an additional scheduling conference date. Court granted the defense's request. Case adjourned to Branhc 45.
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Wagner.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Kies, Br. 45.

Defendant Rickardo Otha Richards in court, appear by video with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw, appear in person.  Defendant Rickardo Otha Richards in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Rickardo Otha Richards not in court, defendant in custody.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Rickardo Otha Richards in court with attorney Dawn Marie Rablin.  Defendant Rickardo Otha Richards in custody.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Rickardo Otha Richards appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 9, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
